intro: Galphimia brasiliensis f. ovata, commonly known as the Brazilian flame flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are vibrant red or orange, with a distinctive tubular shape that attracts pollinators like hummingbirds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
